`+ closure_upperClosure_comm_pi`

`+ dist_mono_right_pi`

Canceled.
bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9421642150/job/25956154762)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9422382499/job/25958543179)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9424297076/job/25964271200)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9424297076/job/25964271086)

One more comment. Feel free to merge even if you disagree.

bors d+
maintainer merge
Seems pretty straightforward, modulo the removal of `Topology.Order.Bounded`
maintainer merge

One more comment. Feel free to merge even if you disagree.

bors d+

You should either introduce a typeclass (and prove instances for `Real`, `Prod`, and `∀ i, X i`) or use `pi` somewhere in the names of all these lemmas.

Also, `Bornology` lemmas should assume `Finite`, not `Fintype`.
UPD: after #10582, you don't need assumptions at all, see `Bornology.forall_isBounded_image_eval_iff` and `bddBelow_pi`.
This used to require `Fintype` because this was a lemma about `Metric.IsBounded`
Why do you delete these lemmas instead of generalizing/deprecating them? I see that they should use `Filter.IsBoundedUnder`, what are other reasons?

They are a simple combination of easier lemmas belonging to different areas, namely `Bornology.IsBounded.bddBelow`/`Bornology.IsBounded.bddAbove` and `isBoundedUnder_of` and some quantifier reshuffle. I did not deprecate them because
* I want to be able to remove the file directly
* I cannot state them using `ℝ` in `Topology.Order.Bornology`
* I don't want to have to think about how I should restate them
* I can't redirect to a single lemma within the deprecation
* They have been added for exactly one use anyway

Writing that message, I have now spent too much time thinking about those two lemmas.
I think our current policy would lean towards deprecating them
I have restored `Topology.Order.Bounded`
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#whitespace-and-delimiters says to use `<|`, not `$`.
Please add `pi` somewhere in the name (here and below). Also please add a TODO about finding a right generality for this lemma.
Did you mean "appended"?
What happened to `is_antichain.interior_eq_empty`?
It has already been ported (and generalised) as `IsAntichain.interior_eq_empty`
If you split the changes in this file to its own PR, I'll merge it immediately (in the interest of removing items from out-of-sync)
I think you might have another conflict with yourself on `inter_subset_left`
Well spotted
Should these lemmas also get a `_pi` ending?
Good point

This comment shouldn't hold up this PR, but the relevant lemmas could just take a homeomorphism with a pi-type as an explicit argument. It's not a pretty solution, but I think it would work, and I believe we already have the necessary homeomorphisms available.

(On second thought, would it need to be an order isomorphism too? That probably rules out this idea as being useful)

Yeah, it would also need to be an order isomorphism. That's the crux. We need a way to say "Order on this type is given by those coordinates", which sounds a lot like the `Inducing`/`Embedding` business in the topology part of the library.

Food for thought, I guess

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Topological properties of order-connected sets in ℝⁿ
